definition: even the most brazen person will sometimes feel shame (idiom)

sentences.english: This is something you can figure out for yourself, but you are being coy .
sentences.chinese: 这是你自己就可以弄清楚的东西，但你是在忸怩作态。

sentences.english: Make no mistake, Microsoft isn't playing coy in the smartphone market any longer.
sentences.chinese: 别搞错，微软不再在智能手机市场上忸怩作态了。

sentences.english: He sidled up/over to her and asked her to dance.
sentences.chinese: 他忸忸怩怩走到她跟前请她跳舞。

sentences.english: What I hate is the way he's always rubbing his hand together, "Washing his hands with invisible soap and imperceptible water."
sentences.chinese: 我看不惯的是他那总是忸怩作态地搓手的样子。

sentences.english: Here a girl was being pushed forward into the inner circle with apparent reluctance.
sentences.chinese: 这里有一个姑娘显然是忸忸怩怩地被推进里面的人圈。

sentences.english: While she felt like joining in the argument, Nancy was too shy to open her mouth.
sentences.chinese: 南希虽然浑如参加辩论，但忸怩得不敢启齿。

sentences.english: I don't know. - Don't be so coy , dear.
sentences.chinese: 这是你自己就可以弄清楚的东西，但你是在忸怩作态。

definition: affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
affecting shyness or embarrassment/coy/mincing (walk, manner of speech)/mannered
to hum and haw (idiom); to mumble as if hiding sth/to speak and break off, then start again/to hold sth back
(of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
